channel.title: How do you hide open file location in task manager
channel.description: so im streaming byte to download a file and everything works fine but once it switches to that file you can find the loacation in task manager

its really easy, see my message again, just with 4 lines he can execute it without writing to disk, if the app hes trying to execute is a .net executable

item.title: How do you hide open file location in task manager
item.dc:creator: Weebzo
item.description:
ShadowMonster:

this wouldn’t be an easy thing to do in C#. if this was C++ you could just make your app a link library and inject it into another process so it wouldn’t lead back the original dll (directly) through task manager. keep in mind you would have to manual map to prevent people from reversing its directory.

depends, if the app is .net, he can load it using reflection.
Example:

var assembly = Assembly.Load(bytes);
var paraminfo = assembly.EntryPoint.GetParameters();            
object[] parameters = new object[paraminfo.Length];
assembly.EntryPoint.Invoke(null, parameters);

Read full topic
